```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
I <- signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 2) # current (A)
V <- signif(runif(1, 1, 10), 2) # voltage (V)

ans <- signif(I * V, 2)
dis <- c(V / I)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, range = c(0, 2)*ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 5)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{W}$", signif(sc$questions, 2))
```
Question
========
A voltage source of $`r V` \,\mathsf{V}$ delivers a current of $`r I` \,\mathsf{A}$
to an electric motor that is connected across its terminals. What power is consumed
by the motor?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Use the formula for the power in a circuit:

$$P = I V = (`r I` \,\mathsf{A})(`r V` \,\mathsf{V}) = `r ans` \,\mathsf{W}$$
